definition: to concentrate one's eyebrows/to frown/to scowl
harsh and unreasonable/unexpected

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
eyebrow/upper margin
to face a thousand pointing fingers with a cool scowl (citation from Lu Xun)/to treat with disdain/to defy
pinyin: heng2 mei2 leng3 dui4 qian1 fu1 zhi3

definition: lit. furrowed brows and blazing eyes/to dart looks of hate at sb (idiom)
to scowl and stare down/to defy
to scowl fiercely/to glare

sentences.english: He sits alone all day scowling at passers-by.
sentences.chinese: 他整天独自坐著，横眉怒目地瞪著来往的人。

sentences.english: Now her anger was as hot as mine. We stood on equal ground.
sentences.chinese: 现在她和我一样横眉怒目，互不相让。

sentences.english: IT WAS a hard-eyed, unemotional get-together.
sentences.chinese: 这是一次横眉冷对，毫无感情的见面。

sentences.english: Make a mistake, and a swarm of furious pyjama-clad scribes will pounce.
sentences.chinese: 一旦出错，就会有一群穿着睡衣横眉竖眼的写手冲来。

to glower at each other (idiom)
scowling in anger/rage written across one's face
lit. hair stands up in anger and tips off one's hat (idiom)/fig. seething in anger/raise one's hackles

arrogant and overbearing
angry look
